div.p: RB MSS M198, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.
?MS annotation by Tepper: 'Reply 8.5.80'. Letter not found. 24/4/80.

Ich danke Ihnen, lieber Herr Tepper, für Ihre Notiz über die Stigmaderen.
Stigmoderen? Der 2t. Theil der "native plants" wird erscheinen, sobald die langwierige u kostspielige Arbeit der Holzschnitte vollendet ist; es sind 50-60 dazu nötig.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I thank you, dear Mr Tepper, for your note on the Stigmaderae.
Stigmoderae. M to O. Tepper, 6 April 1880 (in this edition as 80-04-06a) asked about beetle swarms. Tepper's annotation indicates that he had sent a copy of his paper 'on habits of large Stigm. on Mallee'. Tepper (1878) mentions Stigmodera , a genus in the beetle family Buprestidae , with some species feeding on Mallee Eucalyptus species decreasing in number, and another increasing. No other paper meeting the description has been found.
The second part of the Native plants
B79.06.04. The promised second part was never published. will be published as soon as the protracted and expensive work of wood engraving is completed; there are 50-60 necessary for it.
